en.name: Ahimsa
en.short_description: Principle of non-violence in force, speech, or mind
en.description: Ahimsa is the principle of non-violence on the level of force, speech, or mind. Non-harming extends to everything around you: people, animals, nature. You should adhere to this principle when practicing asanas on your mat. You've probably heard teachers say: 'Don't go into a pose through pain.'
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Ahimsa. In all contexts of life, we strive to be loving and accepting, avoid fighting with the world and ourselves, do everything through joy and pleasure. We try to be thoughtful and careful in our words, actions, and thoughts! If a thought comes that someone is 'not right,' we try to look from a different angle, see something good in it. Remember, the ethics of sages concerns not only actions but also consciousness. Spread Universal Love through yourself!

en.name: Satya
en.short_description: Truthfulness in thoughts, words, and actions
en.description: Satya is truthfulness. It means to think, speak, and act consistently. Satya is not just the absence of lies, but an active striving for truth in all manifestations. Following satya helps to free oneself from illusions and distortions in perception of reality, allows one to see things as they really are.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Satya - honesty first of all with yourself. If we used to turn a blind eye to our shortcomings, today we look at them openly and honestly, we don't lie, even if possible unpleasant consequences await us - if you're late for work because you overslept, say so. If you were lazy - be honest with yourself and the world. If you consider yourself a teacher - follow what you teach!

en.name: Asteya
en.description: Asteya is non-appropriation of others' property. The principle is based on the theory that the Universe constantly strives for balance - one who steals will lose as much or even more (remember karma as a cause-and-effect law). This applies not only to things: you cannot appropriate others' thoughts, ideas, achievements.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Asteya - we don't take what belongs to others, neither in life nor in thoughts. We try to think independently, don't use a calculator when we need to count something, don't use others' phrases, thoughts and ideas. If you need practice - come up with your own, by analogy with what the teacher gave. Don't steal time from yourself and others, don't waste it on foolishness. Seek and create your wealth inside, not outside, at least today :)

en.name: Brahmacharya
en.description: Brahmacharya is a concept with several meanings, but mainly implying self-discipline, control over desires and purposefulness in spiritual practice, not just sexual abstinence. In a broader sense, it is following the path of Brahman, the highest consciousness, and striving for it in all actions.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Brahmacharya, striving to accumulate our creative energy, abstaining from sex and thoughts related to it, learning to control emotions, maintaining a calm, peaceful state - detachment from what's happening around us. We direct all our aspirations to the Higher Consciousness, God, the Universe. Try to look at ordinary things - work, cleaning, walking - as service to this World!

en.name: Aparigraha
en.description: Aparigraha is a yoga principle meaning non-possessiveness, non-accumulation, or non-attachment to material things and results of one's activities. In a broader sense, it is freedom from greed, avarice and attachments, as well as rejection of excessive possession and accumulation. This principle is about careful attitude to nature's resources, which consumer society is now depleting. We buy only what we need and don't spend our energy on acquiring and maintaining unnecessary things.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Aparigraha, trying to use only what is needed, think only what is needed, feel only what is needed, do what is necessary. Nature is always purposeful, so let's train ourselves today to be an embodiment of this principle. Don't eat excessively, don't turn on water where it's not necessary, don't strain yourself unnecessarily, don't get angry where you can avoid it. Try to avoid empty conversations.

en.name: Saucha
en.short_description: Purity of body, mind, and speech
en.description: Saucha is purity of body, mind, and speech.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Saucha. A great occasion to do cleaning, both outside and inside: clean body and clothes, apartment and workplace, cleanse all internal spaces: thoughts, feelings, energy.

en.name: Tapas
en.description: Tapas means inner fire, self-discipline and spiritual austerity. It is striving for self-improvement through practice, effort and overcoming difficulties. It implies discipline that helps develop willpower and persistence in spiritual practice. It's not just physical effort, but rather an inner state that motivates action and helps overcome laziness.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Tapas, learning to kindle our inner Fire! We are more diligent in our practice! We strive to maintain a daily routine, overcome our laziness and scattered attention!

en.name: Santosha
en.description: Santosha is a principle denoting contentment and acceptance, as well as gratitude for what exists in the present moment. This doesn't mean passivity or abandoning aspirations, but rather inner peace and recognition of the current state of things.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Santosha - we thank everything that comes into our lives, those successes and failures that are lessons, we thank people and situations. Try to thank yourself, your parents, spouses and partners, children, the world, the Universe. We learn to maintain a positive attitude despite difficulties, try not to make claims to ourselves and the world, but on the contrary thank for the trial, the lesson.

en.name: Svadhyaya
en.description: Svadhyaya is self-education. It means studying information that doesn't distort reality. Replacing negative worldview with adequate one. Svadhyaya includes awareness of one's mental and emotional patterns, observing one's reactions to various situations and understanding how these reactions affect behavior and sensations. Svadhyaya also implies striving for new knowledge and understanding, expanding one's horizons and developing critical thinking.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Svadhyaya, a great chance to learn a new skill, read what has long been postponed, learn to observe ourselves and the world, think critically, realize the main principle of the Masculine (which women also have) - Knowledge. A great occasion to read/watch/listen to spiritual literature, work with Mentors and Teachers!

en.name: Ishvara Pranidhana
en.description: Ishvara Pranidhana in yoga means surrendering to the Higher, dedicating oneself to God or spiritual force. Abandoning the desire to achieve specific goals or compare oneself with others in practice, focusing on the process and deep purpose.
en.practice_tip: Today we practice the principle of Ishvara Pranidhana, a great day to look at the world through the eyes of the Universe. We identify with the higher, realize our connection with the Universe. We strive for freedom from Ego, find refuge in higher Consciousness. We engage in meditation, yoga, qigong. We try to free ourselves from the desire to achieve specific goals or compare ourselves with others in practice, focusing on the process and deep purpose.

uz.name: Ahimsa
uz.short_description: Kuch, nutq yoki ong darajasida zo'ravonlik qilmaslik tamoyili
uz.description: Ahimsa - kuch, nutq yoki ong darajasida zo'ravonlik qilmaslik tamoyilidir. Zarar yetkazmaslik atrofingizdagi hamma narsaga tegishli: odamlar, hayvonlar, tabiat. Bu tamoyilga yoga amaliyotida amal qilish kerak. Ustalardan "Og'riq orqali asanaga kirma" degan so'zlarni eshitgan bo'lsangiz kerak.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Ahimsa tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, hayotning barcha kontekstlarida mehribon va qabul qiluvchi bo'lishga harakat qilamiz, dunyo va o'zimiz bilan kurashdan qochamiz, hamma narsani quvonch va zavq orqali qilamiz. So'zlarimiz, harakatlarimiz va fikrlarimizda ehtiyotkor va mehribon bo'lishga harakat qilamiz! Agar kimdir 'noto'g'ri' degan fikr kelsa, boshqa burchakdan qarashga harakat qilamiz, unda yaxshi narsalarni ko'rishga urinamiz. Donishmandlarning axloqi nafaqat harakatlarga, balki ongga ham taalluqliligini eslang. O'zimiz orqali Koinot Muhabbatini tarqatamiz!

uz.name: Satya
uz.description: Satya - rostgo'ylik. Bu bir xil tarzda o'ylash, gapirish va harakat qilishni anglatadi. Satya - shunchaki yolg'onning yo'qligi emas, balki barcha ko'rinishlarda haqiqatga faol intilishdir. Satyaga rioya qilish illyuziyalar va haqiqatni idrok qilishdagi buzilishlardan ozod bo'lishga yordam beradi, narsalarni qanday bo'lsa, shunday ko'rishga imkon beradi.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Satya tamoyilini mashq qilamiz - birinchi navbatda o'zimizga nisbatan halollik, agar ilgari kamchiliklarimizga ko'z yumgan bo'lsak, bugun ularga ochiq va halol qaraymiz, yolg'on gapirmaymiz, hatto bizni noxush oqibatlar kutayotgan bo'lsa ham - ishga kechikkan bo'lsang, uxlab qolganim uchun, deb ayt. Dangasalik qildim - o'zim va dunyo bilan halol bo'l. O'zingni ustoz deb hisoblasang - o'rgatgan narsangga amal qil!

uz.name: Asteya
uz.description: Asteya - begona narsani o'zlashtirmaslik. Bu tamoyil Koinot doimo muvozanatga intiladi degan nazariyaga asoslanadi - o'g'irlik qilgan kishi shuncha yoki undan ham ko'proq yo'qotadi (karmani sabab-oqibat qonuni sifatida eslaymiz). Bu nafaqat narsalarga tegishli: boshqalarning fikrlari, g'oyalari, yutuqlarini o'zlashtirish mumkin emas.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Asteya tamoyilini mashq qilamiz - na hayotda, na fikrlarda begona narsani olmaymiz. Mustaqil fikrlashga harakat qilamiz, hisoblash kerak bo'lganda kalkulyatordan foydalanmaymiz, boshqalarning iboralari, fikrlari va g'oyalarini ishlatmaymiz. Agar amaliyot kerak bo'lsa - o'zingnikini o'ylab top, ustoz bergan narsaga o'xshash qilib. O'zimizdan va boshqa odamlardan vaqt o'g'irlamaymiz, uni bema'ni ishlarga sarflamaymiz. Ichkarida o'z boyligingizni izlang va yarating, tashqarida emas, hech bo'lmaganda bugun :)

uz.name: Brahmacharya
uz.short_description: O'z-o'zini tartibga solish va istaklarga nazorat
uz.description: Brahmacharya - bu bir necha ma'noga ega tushuncha, lekin asosan o'z-o'zini tartibga solish, istaklarga nazorat va ruhiy amaliyotda maqsadli yo'nalishni anglatadi, nafaqat jinsiy tiyish. Kengroq ma'noda, bu Brahman yo'lidan - oliy ongdan borish va barcha harakatlarda unga intilishdir.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Brahmacharya tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, ijodiy energiyamizni to'plashga harakat qilamiz, jinsiy aloqa va u bilan bog'liq fikrlardan tiyilamiz, hissiyotlarni nazorat qilishni o'rganamiz, xotirjam holatni saqlashga harakat qilamiz - atrofimizdagi voqealardan uzoqlashish. Barcha intilishlarimizni Oliy Ong, Xudo, Koinotga yo'naltirish. Oddiy narsalarga - ish, tozalash, sayr qilish - bu Dunyoga xizmat sifatida qarashga harakat qiling!

uz.name: Aparigraha
uz.description: Aparigraha - bu yoganing tamoyili bo'lib, mol-mulk to'plamaslik, jamg'armaslik yoki moddiy narsalar va o'z faoliyati natijalariga bog'lanmaslikni anglatadi. Kengroq ma'noda, bu ochko'zlik, hirs va bog'lanishlardan ozod bo'lish, shuningdek, ortiqcha egalik va jamg'arish qilishdan voz kechishdir. Bu tamoyil tabiat resurslariga ehtiyotkorlik bilan munosabatda bo'lish haqida, hozir iste'mol jamiyati ularni tugatamoqda. Biz faqat kerak bo'lgan narsani sotib olamiz va keraksiz narsalarni sotib olish va xizmat ko'rsatishga energiyamizni sarflamaymiz.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Aparigraha tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, faqat kerak bo'lganini ishlatishga harakat qilamiz, faqat kerak bo'lganini o'ylash, faqat kerak bo'lganini his qilish, zarur narsani qilish. Tabiat doim maqsadga muvofiqdir, mana biz ham bugun bu tamoyilning timsoli bo'lishni mashq qilamiz. Ortiqcha yemang, zarur bo'lmagan joyda suvni yoqmang, zarurat bo'lmagan joyda zo'riqmang, qilmaslik mumkin bo'lgan joyda g'azablanmang. Bo'sh gaplardan qochishga harakat qiling.

uz.name: Saucha
uz.description: Saucha - tana, ong va nutqning pokligi.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Saucha tamoyilini mashq qilamiz. Tozalik bilan shug'ullanish uchun ajoyib imkoniyat, ham tashqarida, ham ichkarida: pokiza tana va kiyim, uy va ish joyi, barcha ichki bo'shliqlarni tozalash: fikrlar, his-tuyg'ular, energetika.

uz.name: Tapas
uz.description: Tapas - ichki olov, o'z-o'zini tartibga solish va ruhiy zohidlikni anglatadi. Bu amaliyot, harakat va qiyinchiliklarni yengish orqali o'zini takomillashtirish intilishidir. Bu ruhiy amaliyotda iroda kuchi va qat'iyatni rivojlantirishga yordam beradigan intizomni anglatadi. Bu shunchaki jismoniy kuch emas, balki harakatga undaydigan va dangasalikni yengishga yordam beradigan ichki holat.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Tapas tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, ichki Olovimizni yoqishni o'rganamiz! Amaliyotga mehr bilan munosabatda bo'lamiz! Kun tartibini saqlashga harakat qilamiz, dangasalik va tarqoqlikni yengamiz!

uz.name: Santosha
uz.description: Santosha - qanoatlanish va qabul qilishni, shuningdek hozirgi lahzada mavjud bo'lgan narsaga minnatdorchilikni ifodalovchi tamoyil. Bu passivlik yoki intilishlardan voz kechishni anglatmaydi, balki ichki tinchlik va mavjud vaziyatni tan olishdir.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Santosha tamoyilini mashq qilamiz - hayotimizga keladigan barcha narsalarga, muvaffaqiyat va muvaffaqiyatsizliklarga - dars bo'lgan narsalarga minnatdorchilik bildiramiz, odamlar va vaziyatlarga rahmat aytamiz. O'zingizga, ota-onangizga, turmush o'rtoqlari va sheriklaringizga, bolalaringizga, dunyoga, Koinotga rahmat aytishga harakat qiling. Qiyinchiliklarga qaramay ijobiy kayfiyatni saqlab qolishni o'rganamiz, o'zimizga va dunyoga da'vo qilishga harakat qilmaymiz, aksincha sinovlar va darslar uchun rahmat aytamiz.

uz.name: Svadhyaya
uz.description: Svadhyaya - o'z-o'zini tarbiyalash. Haqiqatni buzmaydigan ma'lumotni o'rganishni anglatadi. Dunyo haqidagi salbiy tasavvurni adekvat bilan almashtirish. Svadhyaya o'zining aqliy va hissiy naqshlarini anglash, turli vaziyatlarga bo'lgan reaktsiyalarini kuzatish va bu reaktsiyalarning xatti-harakatlar va his-tuyg'ularga qanday ta'sir qilishini tushunishni o'z ichiga oladi. Svadhyaya shuningdek yangi bilim va tushunchaga intilish, dunyoqarashni kengaytirish va tanqidiy tafakkurni rivojlantirishni anglatadi.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Svadhyaya tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, yangi ko'nikma o'rganish uchun ajoyib imkoniyat, uzoq vaqtdan beri javonga qo'yilgan narsani o'qish, o'zimizni va dunyoni kuzatishni o'rganish, tanqidiy fikrlash, Erkak boshlanishining asosiy tamoyilini amalga oshirish (ayollarda ham bor) - Bilim. Ruhiy adabiyotni o'qish/tomosha qilish/tinglash, Ustoz va O'qituvchilar bilan ishlash uchun ajoyib imkoniyat!

uz.name: Ishvara Pranidhana
uz.description: Ishvara Pranidhana - yogada o'zini Oliyga topshirish, o'zini Xudo yoki ruhiy kuchga bag'ishlashni anglatadi. Aniq maqsadlarga erishish istagidan voz kechish yoki amaliyotda boshqalar bilan o'zini solishtirishni tashlab, jarayon va chuqur maqsadga e'tibor qaratish.
uz.practice_tip: Bugun Ishvara Pranidhana tamoyilini mashq qilamiz, dunyoga Koinot ko'zlari bilan qarash uchun ajoyib kun. Yuqori bilan o'zimizni birlashtirish, Koinot bilan aloqamizni anglash. Egoning ozodligiga intilish, oliy Ongda panoh topish. Meditatsiya, yoga, tsigon bilan shug'ullanish. Aniq maqsadlarga erishish istagidan yoki amaliyotda boshqalar bilan o'zimizni solishtirishdan ozod bo'lishga harakat qilish, jarayon va chuqur maqsadga e'tibor qaratish.
